2969DB0C1EF84F7A94A1B5AE4AE3BDEE.description: Identify the risk factors associated with sinful behavior and those who might misuse another person

33750834A1B34E2A8435C4146761E536.description: Differentiate between holy and sinful behavior

AAF2B905D0FB4BF5A25D362A8E38AFC5.description: Identify personal boundaries that no one, not even a relative, should cross

AE929BBB42674D19B020E035B0109812.description: Recognize experiences of good and had human relationships and friendships

E2467ACB804B402BBF8D49FBF51B4A5C.description: Explain consequences of sin and how it hurts other people

9A208DCF4277474A99F0713EDDF83DED.description: Understand each human being is created in the image and likeness of God

8FF8CA5DC5AC42129ED3EAB6DEC1192E.description:
Safe Environment
To help Christians realize that each person deserves to be loved and cared for and can help themselves stay safe

4D5ED18FB6B44B668F9CE1978FB74C95.description: Identify opportunities to create change in personal behavior and/or attitude

6A15D626BDFD4D768AC95EBD8B625A20.description: Evaluate wants and needs in relation to the common good

9426CF3B538F4BADB76F0FDCC242E9D9.description: Give a personal witness story of their own faith life

E69CCDC241254709A6B838171D26CBA2.description: Give witness to Catholic principles and values in all aspects of daily life

5AB9A3F80DA4403488D315A83F8A4CE3.description: Discuss the issues of homelessness, hunger, poverty, and illiteracy through the social teaching of the Church

6E2BFEE815F448D5AF5CC9E4197AA1C1.description: Identify forces of violence, oppression, and injustice throughout history and in society today

FFF49EBB46534369A9421CD44C8BF6AF.description: Live as disciples of Christ through the knowledge and practice of Catholic social teaching

573A9E7AC918419388068E2269549B3C.description: Visit a convent, seminary, monastery, or rectory to understand what it means to live as an ordained priest or religious priest, brother, or religious sister

06F869C62480499CBB5A031F6DB26B5D.description: Identify founders of major religious communities and how their followers serve the Church today

F5BC759404624C1CBBB5A0D42416E661.description: Identify the contributions of various religious orders throughout the world

76E02C618DC34AE88E9DC977485F0F1D.description: Understand that every person is called to holiness and lay people contribute to the church according to their own state in life (CL 16)

18BFA59105884D64888B0BD4749744D6.description: Recognize and respond to our baptismal call of service according to our vocation in life

6B53D1F21302453482EF875FB77DFFB9.description:
Evangelization and Missionary Spirit
To prepare Christians to participate in society as faith-filled disciples and to be able to witness their faith in word and deed

72A2922752624E68A9D271DB7257374B.description: Identify and interpret our duty to work with religious and civic leaders to build a world based on justice and the common good

FB775565645D4ACA8B540DFFBA75654B.description: Distinguish between the long-lasting happiness that comes from God and temporary happiness that comes from the world and things

7E3FDEC3216F441E81D1BB3122723674.description: Foster responsibility for changes in behavior to enhance Christian virtue

0EA90E741DA049EA87CC44A264129868.description: Cultivate human values and Christian virtue

881642867F6A48E982348DD0224959BB.description: Describe the relationship between charity and justice

CA90D43D411E42EE96B01A426B1F1BB0.description: Actively participate in the life and work of the local and global Church

FC825314153F46B486FABBFFD176B630.description:
Community Life through Discipleship in the Church
To prepare Christians to live in community and to participate actively in the life and mission of the Church

7C1DA6D61F6F4C069077874BA7F95858.description: Learn how to teach and model prayer to other students

3AE4B61E3C2040B29530BD965F091003.description: Recognize the importance of the role of Scripture in our prayer life

43C9F3E109954EE49F840CE9254983E3.description: Pray the appropriate eighth grade prayers

9AF5E95533974A6FB77A9967DF30185F.description: Know and participate in Catholic prayers

87ACB6BBFF074CC389B0AB2D15279497.description: Pray for the various complexities of the world

FA6F46DA5CDF4044B3CFDB471109D40B.description: Understand the freedom which comes from approaching God with our deepest needs and concerns

6C5A20E6D4274D298BEE35E9111BEE82.description: Develop a life-long relationship with God through prayer

3B23D588C2FA4D9BACB3A53CBF507650.description:
Prayer
To prepare Christians to come into communion with God by learning to pray with Christ

8BE66CDB3D274B8B9E8676649E6F0ED4.description: Desire to live a moral, holy life

34A467D6A97F47A2A0EE64A9666AC97B.description: Provide examples of how we use a well- formed conscience to make moral decisions

5264B73CFBCA4CE4BF199938EBA92533.description: Identify the risk factors associated with sinful behavior and those who might use another person for their own personal use

765B4ADA49CB4D7695DF9DD937CD709B.description: Understand the nature of sin and personal responsibility

1449975F96BA456EA16786A88628CF76.description: Give examples of how to influence public policy concerning right to life issues

30282E03CC794ACBA45AAA8705F2DAA7.description: Understand that human life is sacred

B8D20E92BD94409DB75F1BE2CAE692B2.description: Relate how sources of violence, oppression, and injustice impact our society today

A533BC6657A64874B2CC98CA7651795F.description: Understand the teachings of the Church on the right to life from natural conception to natural death

11687FBA829A4C198CC9ECC6582775E5.description: Recognize and honor the dignity of human life from natural conception to natural death

DC0D6DBAF64544ED8F01B0BD903FB0D3.description: Know the precepts of the Church

9EDDB8D1A18044E29B78ABF852BBAA7A.description: Recognize the need for grace to live a moral life and to be faithful to Scriptural values

6A50B277BC97442685698174A0FE5128.description: Apply principles of Catholic moral teachings to daily life

65A77DA5E02647D39DF048EC1B7A52AA.description: Understand that living a moral life is a life- long process

4E66AD7D59324273A3631DE8AF68B18C.description: Develop a moral foundation centered in a virtuous life and properly informed conscience through the teaching of the Catholic Church

1691E72BCE41456492BF1AD9074B6CB3.description:
Moral Formation in Jesus Christ
To prepare Christians to grow in holiness and make good moral choices by being drawn into a deep personal relationship with Christ

E716CB15C7A54BB9895350582632F226.description: Explain the reason and history of the Lenten fasting regulations

22397A5E76924564A86121EF0A5005EB.description: Pray the Liturgy of the Hours

8D66076BF6844962A420184A1F36DFF7.description: Understand that the Eucharist “is called ‘real’ not to exclude the idea that the others presences of God are not ‘real’ too, but rather to indicate presence par excellence, because it is substantial and through it Christ becomes present whole and entire, God and man” (MF 39)

7EA79C966D5A495990FFE8DD8F6A3A39.description: Recognize that Christ is present in the real presence of the Eucharist, priest, word, the assembled community (SC 7)

DA2BB870365047AEBB17E49197B3E251.description: Acquire the knowledge, spirituality, and skills which lead to full, conscious, and active participation in the liturgical life of the Church

C2882C023DD84698AE00FE857018FA71.description: Trace the development of the Mass throughout the history of the Church

99EE4C8B5079459E931A415826AC6EAF.description: Understand that the Eucharist is the source and summit of the life of the Church

3CDA9B82283E489580EE951FEE573F79.description: Know and value the importance of the Sacraments of service to the Church – Marriage and Holy Orders

A396DAC8A7F4487BACB7917377EB5351.description: Know and value the importance of the Sacraments of healing – Reconciliation and Anointing of the Sick

01A871B0E02C45BD948E9701CBC268BF.description: Explain the Rite of Christian Initiation of Adults (RCIA)

26AAFB019B684997AD1D107C97324595.description: Understand the significance of the Eucharist as the source and summit of our faith (CCC 1324)

A7BA4AD367564C70B399475DA351C740.description: Trace the development of the Sacraments of initiation through the Church’s history

08C818146E294D97B59E9C321B595CF1.description: Know and value the importance of the Sacraments of initiation, including the dignity and responsibility of Baptism, the deepening of grace in Confirmation, and the centrality of the Eucharist

1EB609A1224C43E0B107061DA215D4A7.description: Describe the process of canonization of a saint

267DE5073FC7449FAAA60D48A0DD57EF.description: Explain the rites of a funeral

C80F5FA643F94DB0904E602FCE196EDA.description: Understand the Christian meaning of death and life after death

2E00458BBA4C44BAADE0C9DFF3B3497D.description: Understand that the Sacraments which are celebrated by the Church are outward signs of God’s love revealed through the Paschal Mystery of Christ

F7150994FF284939BDB6C06ECFC76528.description:
Liturgy and Sacraments
To prepare Christians to understand and foster a full, active, and conscious participation in the celebration of the liturgy and Sacraments

94BB1B25A51145918682B9B69A746E71.description: Explain the communion of saints - “this expression refers first to the "holy things" (sancta)” and "refers also to the communion of "holy persons" (sancti) (CCC 960-961)

EE02FC78A8F0420794B7C2F3C60A6CF8.description: Understand the mission of the Church is to “announce, bear witness, make present, and spread the mystery of the communion of the Holy Trinity” (CCC 738)

8F95B59573D24ED486ABE3D402ED9D5A.description: Develop knowledge of the Church by exploring the creeds and Acts of the Apostles

93B83E706FD647DBBA511029AC17145E.description: Understand the four marks of the Church – one, holy, catholic, apostolic

87439D9AA4AF4EB9A2C373EC6C64304E.description: Know that salvation is a gift from God that requires us to respond in faith and good works

3CCADC360CD245F9842FD5C15A7C37CA.description: Understand the core teachings of the Catholic Church

41753ADC71B344BEB142DB1A3F819D3C.description: Explore the origins, the history, and the mission of the Church and the role of the Church in salvation

C769F220003D42D181EACF8B87F572D7.description: Recognize the importance of knowing the Catholic faith to engage in ecumenical dialogue

5F95C77188654DEDAA39867153760D33.description: Name holy men and women who lived throughout history and live now as disciples

B2A6C3777A4C41D69015DDD6FE1D3002.description: Recognize some significant developments in church history after the time of Jesus

78A76C9476FB47E6BDCEC9E27CEA8DD1.description: Learn the history of the Catholic Church and its role in the world

4A2F01F516604FD0B83CA89E337D04CF.description: Define oral tradition, literary forms, and synoptic Gospels

E5C46820E7AB4CEFBA12570BC944553A.description: Explore, understand, and apply Scripture to life through the guidance of the Magisterium

E5481346E4D94D22A1F9BD63DD765CD7.description: Discuss the implications for how belief in Jesus affects our life

CAAB8325A9B34084BEEFDC00A21393B6.description: Reflect on God’s revelation and thus come to understand our human desire for God

B743DAE106F447C0B2FA318E210673DC.description: Explain that faith is our life response to God, who reveals Himself to us

084FF9D46C2F42CDA4B4BD0C0EF739EA.description: Know and retell the story of Salvation History

9CB177605A90425BB9E3CA6DD65BF6FB.description: Recognize through revelation that God desires to be in relationship with us

2D4DB2C87C9F40D7B714E56CDBA101EB.description:
Knowledge of Faith:
To prepare Christians to know, understand, and integrate the foundational beliefs of the Catholic faith through Sacred Scripture, Tradition, and teachings of the Magisterium
